SwissCheese.engine.camera

Class Mover

  • java.lang.Object
    • SwissCheese.engine.camera.Mover

  • public class Mover
extends java.lang.Object
    Moves the camera:

  • Forward
  • Backward
  • Left
  • Right

    • Pans the camera:

  • Left
  • Right

    • Each type of movement will have two methods: start and stop. When a movement is started, an new thread is created to run a while loop for said movement. The stop method would interrupt the while loop, thus stopping the movement

    Left and right movement may have incorrect calculations and will be figured out once the graphics load and are working.

Since:
2018-12-10, v0.2
Version:
v0.1
Author:
Alex Kalinins

      void moveBackward()
      Creates and delegates a thread to calculate backward movement.
      void moveForward()
      Creates and delegates a thread to do a loop of move forward calculations until stopForward() void is called and the thread is interrupted.

      Moves the camera to the left.
      void moveRight()
      Moves the camera to the right.
      void panLeft()
      Pans camera to the left
      void panRight() 
      void stopBackward()
      Sets movebackward to false, ending the backward movement.
      void stopForward()
      Sets moveforward to false, interrupting the moveForward thread.
      void stopLeft()
      Stops the camera left movement
      void stopPanLeft()
      Stops left panning
      void stopPanRight() 
      void stopRight()
      Stops the camera from moving to the right
